title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: In North Castle Street may be seen the house— No. 39—occupied by Sir Walter Scott during the most interesting period of his life, from 1800 to 1826. In the more western districts of Edinburgh some very fine streets are embraced, among others Melville Street, Chester Street, Manor Place, Palmerston Place, Lansdowne and Grosvenor Places, or Crescents. St. Mary's Cathedral is at the end of Melville Street.
